result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey S Wenzel Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed/Sayed WI State Prison Total 3 1/2 years.  18 months IC, 2 years ES.  Deft. IS NOT Eligible for CIP.  Deft. IS Eligible for SAP.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA of $538.00 payable to Clerk of Courts at the rate of $50/month beginning 9/1/22.  In default of payment, referral to State Debt Collection.  Submit DNA Sample.  Supervision fees as ordered and payable to DOC during probation.
Obtain HSED or equivalency of high school diploma.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or part time if in school.
Continue w/AODA Assessments, counseling and treatment deemed necessary by agent.
No possession/consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia - absolute sobriety.  No controlled substance w/o valid prescription.
No contact with known drug users, drug dealers, or drug houses.
